line.originaltext: 3 quarts peanut oil for frying
line.annotation: create_ing(ing0, "3 quarts peanut oil for frying")

line.originaltext: 2 tablespoons salt
3 tablespoons coarse ground black pepper
line.annotation: create_ing(ing2, "3 tablespoons coarse ground black pepper")

line.originaltext: 2 tablespoons cayenne pepper
2 tablespoons garlic salt
2 tablespoons onion salt
2 cups all-purpose flour
6 eggs, beaten
6 pounds beef ribs, cut into single rib pieces
line.annotation: create_ing(ing8, "6 pounds beef ribs, cut into single rib pieces")

line.originaltext: Heat the oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Heat the oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Heat the oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a medium bowl, mix together the salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic salt, and onion salt.
In a medium bowl, mix together the salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic salt, and onion salt.
line.annotation: combine({ing1, ing2, ing3, ing4, ing5}, ing9, "spices", "in a medium bowl")

line.originaltext: Place the flour in a separate bowl or plate.
Place the flour in a separate bowl or plate.
Whisk eggs in a large bowl.
Whisk eggs in a large bowl.
Rub the spice mixture onto all of the ribs.
Dip each rib in egg, then in flour, then egg, then flour again.
Place the ribs in a fryer basket so they are not crowded, try 4 or 5 at a time depending on the size of your fryer.
Place the ribs in a fryer basket so they are not crowded, try 4 or 5 at a time depending on the size of your fryer.
Cook for about 8 minutes.
line.annotation: cook(ing11, t4, ing12, "fried ribs", "8 mins, makeing sure they are not crowded")
